intro: Setirebutia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. These plants are native to regions in South America, particularly in the Andes, where they thrive in temperate climates. Setirebutia species often grow in moist, well-drained soils and are valued for their ornamental appeal in gardens. Their foliage is usually broad and lance-shaped, adding visual interest throughout the growing season.
